title: What is the recommended format an applicant should use for a college application essay? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are applying to schools using the Common Application, then the program designed by them will shape the format you use. You don’t have much choice about how it looks. It will automatically change your format to the one they accept.  Here is what CA says about formatting on their site:  Currently, paragraph breaks for your Common App personal essay will appear in the text box or the print preview of your application. Bold, underline, and italics will always carry over to Print Preview. Extra spaces will be removed automatically when you click continue. This means that you will not be able to indent your paragraphs. Colleges are aware of this formatting and take it into consideration when viewing your essay

This really depends on the situation, the particular prompt to which you are responding, as contexts differ. I just completed a short eBook that I put up on Amazon-Kindle for the minimum price possible (99 cents): Personal Statements & Statements of Purpose: Top 10 Mistakes to Avoid. As far as general principles for writing essays are concerned, you could find most of them there. Hope that’s helpful.
